title.narrative: INCREASED KNOWLEDGE FOR INFORMED DECISIONS MAKING

description.narrative: By 2023, adolescent girls and boys have increased knowledge to make informed decisions,which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Hiv Prevention, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more adolescent girls and boys participate in their communities and utilize services adapted to their needs while the resilience of their communities is strengthened in target areas

participating-org.narrative: CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATION: Community based organization

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening - life skills (for personal empowerment, active citizenship, etc.)
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burundi Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Adolescent Empowerment & Community Resilience)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Burundi 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burundi 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burundi 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, adolescent girls and boys have increased knowledge to make informed decisions

description.narrative: UNICEF equipped more than 23,562 adolescents (12,474 girls and 11,088 boys) with skills that enhanced their resilience and provided them with community participation opportunities. The Ministry of Communication is supported to develop a comprehensive C4D strategy to support the implementation of the Burundi National Development Plan (NPD). | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:27/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of innovation labs set up and operational with UNICEF support
Existence of a multisectoral action plan and / or policy on adolescents (reflecting sectoral commitments for adolescents)
Service Delivery - Schools that have included life skills and citizenship education in their school plans with UNICEF support

Service Delivery - Skills - Number of children who have participated in skills development programmes for learning, personal empowerment, active citizenship and/or employability through UNICEF-supported programmes
Number of adolescent boys and girls who complete at least one skills development program through formal or informal training opportunities
Comprehensive behaviour change communication strategy for adolescent girls and boys and youth including those from key populations available
